repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Utica, NY, Building Trades Council Minute Books on Microfilm
did.abstract: Meeting minutes of the Building Trades Council of Utica, New York, from May 5, 1933 to July 26, 1934.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Building Trades Council is a constituionally mandated department of the AFL-CIO. It was started on February 10, 1908 to overcome the jurisdictional conflicts in the building and construction trade unions. It helps coordinate local unions in the building trades, with contract negotiations and apprenticeship and training programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This consists of meeting minutes of the Building Trades Council of Utica, New York, from May 5, 1933 to July 26, 1934.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Utica, NY, Building Trades Council Minute Books on Microfilm #5829 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
